lead_paragraph: HALPIN--William Curtis, died peacefully at home on January 26 after prolonged battles with advanced prostate cancer. Born August 22, 1929, he was the son of the late John Hadden Halpin and the late Josephine Roll Young. Having attended Monclair public schools, he graduated from Dartmouth College in 1951. He served in the U.S. Air Force from 1951 to 1955 as a radar observer in B-59 sorties over North Korea. Having joined Oxford University Press in 1955, he remained for 26 years, retiring in 1981 as Executive Vice President of the New York office. Relocated to Key West, Florida, he co-founded the Real Estate Company of Key West Inc. There he was active on the boards of the Key West Art and Historical Society and the Hospice-VNA of the Florida Keys. He subsequently retired to Fort Lauderdale, FL, where he lived with his longtime partner of 21 years, Calvin Victor Temenski. They were married in 2015. He was predeceased by his parents, his brother, Robert T. Halpin of Dallas, Texas and his sister, Sally H. Knaus of Oneonta, New York and survived by his brother, the Honorable Judge Jack Halpin, ten nieces and nephews and many grand-nieces and nephews. A Memorial Service will be held at a later date in the summer of 2016 in Essex, New York. Details to be announced. 1/3
